alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 2:28PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PULASKI...EASTERN WYTHE AND NORTHWESTERN CARROLL COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grahams Forge, or near Patterson, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pulaski... Dublin... Patterson... Allisonia... Max Meadows... Claytor Dam... and Fort Chiswell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
